title: Being Courteous to Bots Sparks Dispute

lines.linesSec1: DEAR ABBY: My wife and I are having a minor argument, and we are seeking your help in resolving it. We live in an age when we commonly experience conversations with robo-calls, virtual assistants (Alexa and Echo) and phone routing software. All this technology is powered by artificial intelligence. So given that we are talking to machines, do we need to follow the rules of etiquette with these robots? My wife insists we should say Thank you and Please to these software creations, while I say no manners are needed. Your thoughts? -- MULLING IT OVER IN MONTANA.
lines.linesSec2: DEAR MULLING IT: Although it isn't mandatory, I know of at least one AI assistant that would acknowledge the courtesy.
